summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a FOIA request from a media company for audio, video, photographic, and other records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The response indicates that any such materials are evidence in an ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Maxwell and have not been made public.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the pending criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the FOIA request for records related to her and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as 'JE' throughout the FOIA request items; the request seeks records related to him, his properties, and associates.

persons.name: Virginia L Giuffre
persons.context: Named in the civil case Virginia L Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-7433), which is noted as not involving the SDNY.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: The requester from a media company seeking public documents related to Epstein and Maxwell cases; name appears in the email subject line.

connections.description: The FOIA request seeks records related to both individuals together, indicating their association in the investigation and criminal case.
Connected through the civil case Virginia L Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-7433).

events.title: FOIA Request Correspondence
events.description: Email exchange regarding a FOIA request from a media company for audio, video, photographic, and other records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York states that any materials in the requested categories related to Epstein and Maxwell are evidence in an ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Maxwell and have not been made public.

The FOIA request specifically seeks audio, video, photographic, and other records including 911 calls, interviews with victims and witnesses, surveillance, and depositions related to Epstein and Maxwell.
The request is from a media company, but the response indicates that the materials are not public due to the ongoing nature of the case.
Two cases are referenced: the civil case Virginia L Giuffre v. Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-7433) and the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
